meanings.definition: Skill or expertise in a particular field or activity.
meanings.sent1: Her maestri in painting was evident from the intricate details in her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The musician's maestri on the piano captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: Despite his maestri in cooking, he still managed to burn the toast.
meanings.sent4: His maestri in negotiation turned the tide of the business deal.
meanings.sent5: The maestri of the sculptor brought life to the marble statue.

meanings.definition: The highest level of skill or accomplishment in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: Reaching maestri in ballet requires years of dedicated practice.
meanings.sent2: The chef's maestri in culinary arts earned him a Michelin star.
meanings.sent3: Her maestri in gardening was so impressive that even the flowers seemed to applaud.
meanings.sent4: The maestri of the acrobat was like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The maestri of the architect was evident in the grandeur of the cathedral.

meanings.definition: A person who is highly skilled or accomplished in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The maestri of the violinist left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: She was considered a maestri in the field of astrophysics.
meanings.sent3: The maestri of the magician made the rabbit disappear... and reappear in her hat!
meanings.sent4: He was a maestri in the art of storytelling, weaving tales that mesmerized all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The maestri of the surgeon saved countless lives in the operating room.
